verses.roman:
ya evam avyākṛta-śakty-udanvataḥ
parasya sākṣāt paramātmano hareḥ
giritra-mokṣaṁ kathayec chṛṇoti vā
vimucyate saṁsṛtibhis tathāribhiḥ

synonyms: yaḥ—whoever; evam—thus; avyākṛta—inconceivable; śakti—of energies; udanvataḥ—of the ocean; parasya—the Supreme; sākṣāt—personally manifest; parama-ātmanaḥ—of the Supersoul; hareḥ—Lord Hari; giritra—of Lord Śiva; mokṣam—the saving; kathayet—recites; śṛṇoti—hears; vā—or; vimucyate—is freed; saṁsṛtibhiḥ—from repeated births and deaths; tathā—as well as; aribhiḥ—from enemies.
translation: Lord Hari is the directly manifest Absolute Truth, the Supreme Soul and unlimited ocean of inconceivable energies. Anyone who recites or hears this pastime of His saving Lord Śiva will be freed from all enemies and the repetition of birth and death.

purport.content: Śrīla Śrīdhara Svāmī concludes this chapter with the following statement:

bhakta-saṅkaṭam ālokyakṛpā-pūrṇa-hṛd-ambujaḥ
giritraṁ citra-vākyāt tumokṣayām āsa keśavaḥ
"When Lord Keśava saw the danger confronting His devotee, His lotuslike heart became filled with sympathy. Thus He delivered Lord Śiva from the consequences of his own eloquent words."
